rows.title: Why is 24.0000 not equal to 24.0000 in MATLAB?
Convert columns into rows with Pandas
Convert Rows to columns using 'Pivot' in SQL Server
How can I access the contents of an iframe with JavaScript/jQuery?

542: <p>I think what you are doing is subject to the <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Same_origin_policy" rel="noreferrer">same origin policy</a>. This should be the reason why you are getting <em>permission denied type</em> errors.</p>
545: <p>Look at this article: <a href="http://www.lahey.com/float.htm" rel="noreferrer">The Perils of Floating Point</a>. Though its examples are in FORTRAN it has sense for virtually any modern programming language, including MATLAB. Your problem (and solution for it) is described in "Safe Comparisons" section.</p>
<p>Maybe the two numbers are really 24.0 and 24.000000001 but you're not seeing all the decimal places.</p>

<p>Check out the <a href="https://www.mathworks.com/help/matlab/ref/eps.html" rel="nofollow noreferrer">Matlab EPS function</a>.</p>

<p>Matlab uses floating point math up to 16 digits of precision (only 5 are displayed).</p>
